page.title: 12BEDS.GROWERS SUTTON
page.content: Bedfordshire Growers was established in 1965 and is a co-operative of farmers to help the sales and distribution of vegetables in the area.Farmers send a range of crops to the depot including Brussels Sprouts,potatoes,cabbage and lettuce.About 130 farmers are members and 100 of them use the co-operative regularly.Produce is sent to wholesale markets,supermarkets and shops.Some produce is sent abroad and this is easier now that Britain is in the Common Market.Most of the transport used by Beds.Growers is hired. About 70 people work at he depot.They come from Biggleswade and surrounding villages.The ladies in the packing house work from 8-30am until 3-30pm.The requisites shop is open from 8am until 5pm.The office staff begin work at 7pm.
